com.salvation.building.environmental_lab: The scientific method - useful for more than profit.
container.salvation.purifying_furnace.de: Can extract the corruption from what it cooks.
com.salvation.coremod.gui.environmental_: Place a beacon core on top of 4 Tier 3+ building materials to form a Purifying Beacon.
salvation.research_credit.invalid: Attempted to withdraw a research credit from an invalid building.
com.salvation.research.effects.lycanthro: Reduce the chance of animals in the colony being corrupted by +%3$s%%.
com.salvation.research.effects.sustainab: Increase the maximum building level to avoid negative environmental effects by %d.
com.salvation.research.effects.clean_fue: Reduce the environmental impact of burning fuel by %d.
com.salvation.research.effects.enable_be: Allows the lab tech to maintain Purification Beacons.
com.salvation.research.effects.beacon_ra: Extends beacon range by a radius of %d chunk.
com.salvation.research.effects.beacon_fr: Increases beacon pulses by %d per day.
tooltip.salvation.corruption_ward.flavor: Corruption Ward allows safer use of the tool in the environment.
tooltip.salvation.purified_items.flavor: Purified items are a little safer and more receptive to the Corruption Ward enchantment.
salvation:labtech.job.desc: Works to understand and counteract corruption.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.1: Nature's beauty brings a sense of peace.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.2: The land rests easily beneath your feet.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.3: The world feels strong and well-rested.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.4: The animals move with quiet confidence.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.5: The air feels clean and steady.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.6: The sky is calm and untroubled.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.7: Plants grow as they always have.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage0.9: The roots below feel deep and secure.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage1.1: The land feels strained, as if too much is asked of it.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage1.4: The air feels thicker than it should.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage1.6: The plants seem stunted and unhealthy.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage1.7: The clouds feel thick and sickly.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage1.9: You can't shake the feeling of being watched.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.0: The land groans under unseen weight.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.2: Animals avoid places they once trusted.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.4: Some plants refuse to grow at all.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.5: The wind carries an anxious tone.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.6: The sky feels distant and cold.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage2.7: The soil no longer feels alive.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage3.7: This place doesn't remember how it used to be.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage3.9: Something is interfering with the natural order.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.0: The land is fevered - as if fighting off an infection..
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.3: What grows here does not feel healthy.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.4: Every sound feels like a warning.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.7: This place craves peace, but can find none.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.8: The world feels angry and embattled.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage4.9: Environmental collapse isn't inevitable - it is a product of carelessness.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage5.1: Creatures move as if driven by fear.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage5.4: The world cries out in pain.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage5.5: The sky feels wrong in every way.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage5.6: The ground no longer supports life.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage5.9: Corruption feeds on life and gives nothing back.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage6.1: Nothing here behaves as it should.
com.salvation.flavormessage.stage6.9: There is no tunnel; much less a light at the end; just stifling darkness.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.townhall.ha: The colony's efforts at sustainable living.
com.salvation.coremod.gui.chat.recruitst: I was traveling when the birds went quiet all at once. Figured I better find shelter, just in case!
Nothing really wrong where I came from. Nothing anyone could put a finger on, anyway. It just didn't feel the same.
The crops looked fine, but they didn't feel right somehow. Hard to explain.
I had trouble sleeping back home. The nights felt... heavier.
Animals were acting skittish. Probably just the weather, but I moved on anyway.
I like quiet places, but my village got TOO quiet. Suspiciously so. It's not like that here, is it?
I caught myself watching the ground more than the sky. Didn't like that. I'm looking for a new start.
Everyone said things were fine. I wasn't so sure. Some of the creatures in the dark... they didn't look right.
The river tasted strange one morning. I decided it was time to pick up and leave.
I just wanted a place that still felt normal.
Back home, the land looked tired. Like it needed a long rest.
We worked harder every season, but got less for it. Our scientists said they had a cure, but the politicians never listened. I had to leave.
Some animals wouldn't eat, others wouldn't stop. You ever seen a pig stand up and stare you in the eye like YOU were bacon? Not for me.
The soil kept crumbling in my hands. Never used to do that. Bereft of life. Sucked dry.
I heard stories of places where the land still cooperates. Is this one of them? Maybe I'd like to stay.
I kept saying 'You cannot keep taking taking taking and never give!' Nature don't work like that. Who listened?  Nobody.
It felt like the world was asking something of us. Nobody wanted to listen. I left.
I left when the livestock started changing their routines.
The nights grew longer. Or maybe it just felt that way.
I'm hoping your colony feels steadier than the road behind me.
I watched a field go barren in a single season. Corruption throughout. Rotten to the core. I need help.  Will I find it here?
Some animals were born wrong. Not wrong like 'poor guy has three legs' but WRONG - like 'dang cow tried to eat me'.
The ground cracked where it never had before. A stench wafted up and corrupted water poured forth. Filth. Filth everywhere.
Roots was our head ecologist. Always said 'The land always asks for help, and in our town we listen!' But when Roots died, people stopped listening. Things got bad.
Conspiracy theorist? Not me. The corruption DOES seem in through thin spots to a corrupted land. We DO make it worse by our own actions. Don't look at me like that...
I heard whispers of places the land itself rejected. Sucked it through a hole to somewhere else. Nightmare fuel. I don't want to go there.
Water pooled where it shouldn't, dark and rippling with ill intent. It left an oily film on all it touched. I still smell it in my worst dreams.
Something is spreading. Slowly, but surely. Step by step. Cut tree by cut tree. Cloud of coalsmoke by cloud of coalsmoke. I'm on the run. I hope you can stop it.
My town is dying. I need help. I need it now.
I'd rather help build something than watch it decay.
We started marking places on maps. Places you don't go anymore.
Animals attacked without hunger or fear. Stood right up on two legs and attacked! Story goes that Aemul Benny got EATEN!
The land itself felt hostile underfoot. I don't mean strong glare and a judgy sniff - I mean strike-you-down-where-you-stand hostile!
Some nights the sky looked bruised. Researchers kept telling us to burn this newfangled purification fuel, but nobody did. It was more expensive!
*heheheh* OOOH! *mmmmm?* NO NO NO NO! What? it's here? IT'S HERE!?
We were so close. We invested in science. We built an environmental laboratory. We just started too late. Don't make the same mistake!
You see the green gas? Comes out when you burn? Comes out when you mine? Comes out as through the connections... Smells evil. Gotta fight it.
We kept records. Every furnace burn, every tree felled, every vein mined. The numbers climbed. The land responded. We did this.
They told us corruption was natural. Cycles. Balance. Funny how it only grew when we expanded carelessly.
There are chunks where compasses spin and animals refuse to spawn. Black zones. We pretend they don't exist.
The purification fuel worked. Slowed things down. But slowing isn't stopping, is it?
We lost people to things that used to be animals. We lost people to things that used to be trees. We lost people to things that used to be us.
There are holes... in the ground. They shimmer. They whisper. They grow. They grow. They grow...
When every decision is designed to maximize profit, only the richest survive. But even they can't overcome the corruption with money alone.
I was a scientist? I AM a scientist! Everything is fixable - even corruption! Observe, orient, do, act. Rinse, repeat. It's the only way.
I heard your colony was resisting. A bastion of strength. A beacon in the night. Some bacon in the pan... Tell me there's room for me?
They laughed at me. 'Voraxians?', they said. And laughed. Who is laughing now?  Well, not me either, really... It's too much.
You can smell corruption before you see it. Like burned coal and rot. Running only delays the inevitable.
*singing* No distance too great. No distance to regret. Not a stance to forget. No dance but death. *sighs*
This feels like the last place that matters. Does it matter enough? Does it matter at all?
The world is dying. I won't pretend otherwise. Let's stop whining about it and take this fight to the source!
Corruption took my home. I won't let it take everything. I won't let it take me.
I've seen what happens when it wins. We can't let it win.
Scars are not just the mark of time, they are the mark of violence. Violence against our land. Violence against us.
We discovered the truth too late. A parallel universe ravaged by unquenchable desire for more. More resources, more power. More... more... more... They have nothing left and now eye us.
Billionaires gesture and the world genuflects. Every depravity, every sin, every befouled river - I lay this at their feet.
I don't expect safety. I expect purpose. I expect action. I expect change. Can you give me that?
We either fight the corruption... or become part of it. Our actions can slow it, but only by taking the fight to them can we defeat it.
Cut down a tree? Plant a new tree! It's not that hard. The world naturally fights back against corruption - we're just stripping away the defenses.
Sometimes I think there is no tunnel, much less a light at the end... just stifling darkness. Tell me things are better here.
